snippet: Eric Saldarriaga, a private investigator convicted of hacking into personal email accounts, sought to keep his cooperation with prosecutors secret, fearing retaliation from his clients.
abstract: Eric Saldarriaga, private investigator who was sentenced to three months in prison for hacking into dozens of personal email accounts, now fears retaliation from his clients for cooperating with prosecutors in bid to avoid jail time.
lead_paragraph: Eric Saldarriaga, a private investigator convicted of hacking into personal email accounts, sought to keep his cooperation with prosecutors secret, fearing retaliation from his clients.

headline.main: Hired Hacker Who Named Clients Now Fears Retaliation
headline.print_headline: Hired Hacker Who Named Clients Now Fears Retaliation
